course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Organometallic Chemistry
course.description: Bonding, structure and reactivity of organometallic compounds, ligand substitution, oxidative addition, reductive elimination reactions, insertions and reactions of coordinated ligands, applications to catalytic processes and organic synthesis.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.title: Most favourite course in HKUST
reviews.comment_content:
1. General properties of organometallic complexes
2. Complexes with metal-carbon s bond: Metal alkyls, aryl, hydride and related s -bonded ligands
3. Carbonyls, phosphine complexes
4. Complexes of p-ligands
5. Substitution reactions
6. Oxidative addition and reductive elimination
7. Insertion and elimination
8. Nucleophilic and electrophilic addition and abstraction
9. Carbene and carbyne complexes
10. Homogeneous catalysis

(Suggest to take together with CHEM 3220 if interested)
Prof. Jia will give an introduction at the beginning of the course. Afterward, you will find there are quite a lot of the same materials covered by both courses when CHEM 3220 begins to talk about organometallic chemistry. (Of coz CHEM 4620 will be more in deep but already helps you to understand those in CHEM 3220)
reviews.comment_teaching:
There are many review questions and exercise in class to help you understand the concepts. Sometimes it is hard to understand Prof. Jia's accent but he is quite helpful.
Sample midterm will be uploaded.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm Exam 40%
Final Exam 40%
Presentation 20%

Midterm (*only 9 people taken this course)
Mean: 70/85
Max: 79/85
Min: 5x/85

***To be updated***
reviews.comment_workload:
Not quite.
Just find the similarity of the reactions then not much to remember.

reviews.author: holymama
reviews.title: A course that worth-taking
reviews.comment_content:
Ch.1 Introduction to OM
Ch.2 Complexes with M-C sigma bond
Ch.3 Carbonyl, phosphine complexes
Ch.4 Complexes with pi-bond ligands
Ch.5 Ligand Substitution Reactions

After midterm:
Ch.6 Oxidative Addition and Reductive Elimination
Ch.7 Insertion and Elimination
Ch.8 Electrophilic and Nucleophilic Addition and Abstraction
Ch.9 Carbene and Carbyne Complexes
Ch.10 Homogeneous Catalysts

Compared to other similar course in other universities, Jia's course put much more emphasis on the transition metal part instead of organic part. For reference, please read http://people.fas.harvard.edu/~chem253/

話就話pre-requisite係Inorg 2, 但係個人認為inorg 2嘅野涉及到嘅都係最basic嘅OM, 反而冇讀過org chem嘅同學/org chem底比較差嘅同學會比較慘，因為依個course雖然focus more on transition metal, 但係其實都係alchemy.

做OM lab (華雄，Jiajia)前必讀course,雖然做research好多時候都未必用得著，但係打左個底會好d
reviews.comment_teaching: 有上過CHEM1020就明佢d英文有幾搞笑啦。因為冇lecture video嘅關係所以一定要上堂。堂上面會有好多額外嘅review questions，全部都係以前midterm/final 考過d問題黎, 但係同Gen Chem唔同嘅地方係佢會upload d問題上去。ppt內容非常清晰，有陣時真系被迫需要走堂嗰陣淨係睇翻after lecture notes都會明。
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 40%
Final: 40%
Presentation: 20 %

Format of midterm: MC, Write down the product, Write down the reagent, Mechanism, Bonus question

Format of final: MC, Write down the product, Write down the reagent, Mechanism, Catalytic cycle, Bonus question

Topic of presentation: Any topics that did not cover in the lecture, e.g. : sigma bond metathesis, C-H bond activation

Midterm踩mean
Final考第4 (Total # of students: 11)(Myth: Class schedule and quota寫有17個人， 但係得15個人做present, 考試得11個人蒲頭添)
Presentation唔知自己幾多分(佢冇講)
極度建議搵D有趣d嘅topics, 例如係bio-inorganic, organo-lanthanide, etc.佢好鍾意一d新奇嘅野。

因為依個Course過半班都係PG，所以Grade爛極有限。利申有A

多nds，但係不足掛齒，因為好多都係organic嗰邊嘅人，佢哋自己都話唔習慣從metal角度去學OM.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only workload comes from the presentation, you need to include as many citation as possible, 姐係要你睇好多paper. 佢會upload Homework上canvas, 溫完書可以試下做。Same as sample midterm and final. 有sources其實冇咩作用，因為Jiajia唔會重複考翻以前嘅野，有sources嘅唯一好處就係多d題目做。最佳溫書方法嘅就係做after lecture notes嘅review questions, 雖然Jiajia上堂會做，但係佢飛得太快你根本冇時間諗，反而自己溫書嗰陣自己做一次效率高好多。

當你溫緊Catalyst嗰度嗰陣，恭喜你，你會感到前所未有嘅痛苦， 因為實在係太多catalyst啦，多到你完全唔會記得入腦。好多calalyst真係要死記，因為lecture notes有d catalyst係paper到copy出黎，冇俾mechanisms, 結果final考左。利申final MC錯嘅題目全部都係揀suitable catalyst嘅題目。溫書嗰陣記得擺多少少時間落嗰度。

背野要落少少功夫，因為其實當你熟曬d mechanisms嘅時候，就算幾恐怖幾陌生嘅chemicals同reaction都好其實黎黎去去都係用嗰幾個mechanisms, e.g. OA, RE, beta-hydrogen elimination, insertion, elimation, etc.

reviews.author: lcw233
reviews.title: A perfect course for year 2 spring semester.
reviews.comment_content:
The concept has a lot of overlap with Inorganic Chemistry 2 and can be taken together. A waiver is needed to enroll in this course and the content is not as hard as I thought. The content of this course helped me have a better understanding of inorganic chemistry, especially for the coordinated chemistry and catalyst. The lecture focused on the reaction types of organometallic reactions and their mechanism.

Course Outline
1. General properties of organometallic complexes
2. Complexes with metal-carbon s bonds:
Metal alkyls, aryl, hydride, and related
s-bonded ligands
3. Carbonyls, phosphine complexes
4. Complexes of p-ligands
5. Substitution reactions
6. Oxidative addition and reductive elimination
7. Insertion and elimination
8. Nucleophilic and electrophilic addition and abstraction
9. Carbene and carbyne complexes
10. Homogeneous catalysis
11. Special topic
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. JIA 's accent is quite hard to follow at the beginning but you will find his lecture is really logical and clear after a few lectures. The way he explains the mechanism is really clear and easy to follow and this can also improve the ability to understand organic chemistry mechanism.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is based on your performance only.
Midterm Exam 45%
Final Exam 55%
28 students and some of them are pg.
95% A+
90% A
85% A-
...basically like this. No need to worry about others' performance, unlike some COMP courses.
reviews.comment_workload: Not very hard for a year two student. Basical just follow the professor speed and do some excisersice before the exam is enough. Really recommended to take in year 2 spring semester, since we only have 8 cerdit of CHEM courseand this course have strong relationship with CHEM3220 so it is suitable to have this course as an elective.
